title: Pride Of Britain Awards: England captain Harry Kane is joined by glamourous wife Katie Goodland
text:
Goal scoring exploits were put to one side as Harry Kane enjoyed a night out with wife Katie Goodland at the Pride of Britain Awards on Monday evening.

The Tottenham Hotspur and England captain commanded attention in a sharp grey suit as the couple posed for photos outside London's Grosvenor House Hotel.

Joining her husband, Katie looked stunning in a semi-sheer trouser suit that fully exposed her cleavage.

Side by side: Goal scoring exploits were put to one side as Harry Kane enjoyed a night out with wife Katie Goodland at the Pride of Britain Awards on Monday evening

The pair are parents to two daughters, Ivy Jane, 2, and Vivienne, nine months.

Harry got down on one knee in 2017 on the beach in Nassau, the Bahamas during a romantic holiday.

The duo have enjoyed Kane's rise together - speaking in 2015, he revealed that they went to the same school and occasionally struggle to believe his rise to celebrity status.

Smart: The Tottenham Hotspur and England captain commanded attention as he posed for photos alongside glamorous Katie outside London's Grosvenor House Hotel

They became friends while at Larkswood Primary in east London, before they moved on together to nearby Chingford Foundation School, where Beckham, who captained the England squad almost 60 times, had been a pupil.

They started dating in 2012 when they were aged 16 and attended the school prom together.

Harry told Esquire magazine in 2015: ‘We went to school together, so she’s seen my whole career.

'Of course, she’s finding it a little crazy. I think she’s even been in the papers a couple of times taking the dogs out.’

Fancy meeting you here: Harry was reunited with England manager Gareth Southgate on the red carpet

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars will come together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Happy couple: The footballer got down on one knee on a beautiful beach in Nassau, the Bahamas during a romantic holiday in 2017

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started.

'In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will be broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
